intro: Cheilanthes seemannii, commonly known as the rock fern or seemann's rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a terrestrial, epiphytic, or lithophytic plant, often found growing on rocks or in rocky crevices. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome and produces small, clustered fronds with a leathery texture. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided and have a dark green color with a glossy appearance. Cheilanthes seemannii is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
